title: A man tried to steal a dragon-shaped pedal boat at National Harbor, police say
text:
A man tried to steal a dragon pedal boat at National Harbor, police said. (Rachel S. Cohen) (Courtesy of Rachel S. Cohen/Courtesy of Rachel S. Cohen)

A man was arrested for trying to steal a pedal boat — with a dragon on the front — at National Harbor, police said.

At about 7:15 p.m. Monday, Prince George’s County police responded to the popular entertainment destination off the Capital Beltway.

Bystander Rachel S. Cohen said on Twitter that the man appeared to be “very slowly” moving the dragon-shaped boat.

Police said the man swam to a docked paddle boat and took it from the dock without paying for it. He then paddled it out into the Potomac River. Police had to go out on boats to catch him.

Cpl. Lamar Robinson, a county police spokesman, said the man was “a little bit inebriated.” He said he was arrested without incident.

Robinson said police arrested Kevin Quijano-QuiJada, 32, of Forest Heights. Police officials said it’s not clear why he tried to take the pedal boat. He was charged with theft under $25,000.

National Harbor has several entertainment activities along the Potomac River waterfront, including a water taxi, paddle board yoga and kayaking. Pedal boat operators generally are told to go out a certain distance in the water.

This story has been updated. An earlier version gave an incorrect age for Kevin Quijano-QuiJada. He is 32.
description: A county police spokesman said the man was “a little bit inebriated.” He said officers got the man back to the shore, where he was arrested.
